title: Getting Married
description: Planning a wedding in India involves a blend of traditions, logistics, and legal formalities. Hereâ€™s a guide to help you navigate this joyous occasion.
sentences: Discuss and align on a realistic wedding budget with your partner and families.
Register your marriage legally. You can do this under the Hindu Marriage Act or the Special Marriage Act.
Create a detailed timeline or checklist for booking venues, vendors (caterer, photographer), and sending invitations.
Open communication with your partner about expectations and responsibilities is crucial for smooth planning.
Prioritize what's most important to you as a couple, whether it's the food, decor, or guest experience.
dos: Start planning at least 6-12 months in advance, especially for popular wedding dates.
Create a joint bank account for wedding expenses to track spending easily.
Delegate tasks to willing family members and friends.
Take time out as a couple to relax and connect amidst the planning chaos.
donts: Don't go into significant debt for a one-day event. Plan a wedding you can afford.
Don't try to please everyone; it's your special day.
Don't hire vendors without checking their reviews and signing a contract.
Don't forget to plan for your life after the wedding, including finances and living arrangements.
